user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is: Use of the string handling functions from <string.h> shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters.
This rule strictly applies to the Standard Library functions in <string.h> such as memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, and strspn.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_CountSemCreate_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_CountSemCreate_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token, uint32 sem_initial_value, uint32 options)
{
    OS_impl_countsem_internal_record_t *impl;

    impl = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_count_sem_table, *token);

    if (sem_initial_value > SEM_VALUE_MAX)
    {
        return OS_INVALID_SEM_VALUE;
    }

    if (sem_init(&impl->id, 0, sem_initial_value) < 0)
    {
        return OS_SEM_FAILURE;
    }

    return OS_SUCCESS;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function OS_CountSemCreate_Impl:
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
...
OS_impl_countsem_internal_record_t OS_impl_count_sem_table[OS_MAX_COUNT_SEMAPHORES]
...
typedef struct
{
    sem_t id;
} OS_impl_countsem_internal_record_t
...
static inline osal_index_t OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    return token->obj_idx;
}
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
#define OS_INVALID_SEM_VALUE (-20)
...
#define OS_SEM_FAILURE (-6)
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
OS_impl_countsem_internal_record_t OS_impl_count_sem_table[OS_MAX_COUNT_SEMAPHORES]
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 21.17 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. The fragment only declares an array of OS_impl_countsem_internal_record_t of size OS_MAX_COUNT_SEMAPHORES and does not call any string.h functions. Rule 21.17 concerns use of string handling functions (memcpy, strcpy, etc.) causing out-of-bounds accesses; none are present in this fragment. (A specific hypothetical violation would be if code later used a string function such as memcpy or strcpy with a pointer into OS_impl_count_sem_table and a length that causes idx + length/sizeof(...) to exceed OS_MAX_COUNT_SEMAPHORES — that would violate Rule 21.17.)
